intro: Galium lucidum subsp. aetnicum, commonly known as the Ethiopian bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in cymes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with cool, temperate climates. Galium lucidum subsp. aetnicum is notable for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
